cip.render.raytrace.material

Class Whitted

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.raytrace.material.Blinn
      • cip.render.raytrace.material.Whitted
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDynXmlObject, INamedObject, IRtMaterial

    public class Whitted
extends Blinn
    An implementation of the Whitted illumination model as described in Whitted, Turner (1980), "An Improved Illumination Model for Shaded Display", Communications of the ACM, vol. 23, no. 6, pp. 343-349. The Whitted model is implemented on top of the Blinn illumination model - the Blinn model provides the basic surface illumination, this model adds the reflected and transmitted global illumination components.

    This implementation supports a combination of a constant recursion (bounce) depth cutoff and adaptive recusion depth cutoff based upon the contribution that the ray can make to the colour of the pixel. Generally, depth is adaptively terminated before the absolute cutoff ts reached and the absolute cutoff is a guard against pathologic environments that could reflect rays forever (i.e. 100% reflective).

    The Whitted illuminated material is specified as a node in an XML file as:

        <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.material.Whitted" name="materialName">
          <colour RGBf_attributes/>
          <beta>betaDegrees</beta>
          <conductor/>
          <dielectric/>
          <transparent/>
          <opaque/>
          <indexOfRefraction>n</indexOfRefraction>
          <transmittance>transmittance</transmittance>
          <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="slopeDistributionFunction"/>
          <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="geometricAttenuationFunction"/>
        </DynamicallyLoadedObject>

     where:

    colour or <colour The material colour as specified by the RGBf_attributes which are described in RGBf.setValue().
    beta The beta angle, or angle of deviation between N and H when the slopes distribution is half the value as when N = H. Valid values are 2 degree to 45 degree. The default is 45 degree if not specified.
    conductor If specified, the material is a conductor and the specular colour is set equal to the material colour. conductor and dielectric are mutually exclusive. If not specified, the material defualts to a dielectric.
    dielectric If specified, the material is a dielectric and the specular colour is 1,1,1. conductor and dielectric are mutually exclusive.
    opaque Ihis is an opaque, reflective material. opaque and transparent are mutually exclusive. If not specified, the material defaults to a opaque.
    transparent This is a transparent, reflective material. opaque and transparent are mutually exclusive. If not specified, the material defaults to a opaque.
    indexOfRefraction The index of refraction of the material. This is only applicable for a transparent material. If not specified, the index of refraction defaults to 1.5 (the equivalent of common window glass).
    transmittance This is the transmittance of the material. This is only applicable for a transparent material. If not specified, the transmittance defaults to 0.95 (the equivalent of common window glass).
    DynamicallyLoadedObject This is the specification of either the a slope distribution function (the object implements the IRtD interface) or the geometric attenuation function (the object implements the IRtG interface). If not specified, the default slope distribution function is the Blinn function, and the geometric attenuation defaults to 1.

    Example of XML Specification

    The following specifies a glass material using the Blinn slope distibution function:

        <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.material.Whitted" name="green">
          <colour rgb="0,1,0"/>
          <dielectric/>
          <beta>5</beta>
          <transparent/>
          <indexOfRefraction>1.5</indexOfRefraction>
          <transmittance>0.8</transmittance>
          <DynamicallyLoadedObject class="cip.raytrace.material.D.Blinn"/>
        </DynamicallyLoadedObject>

    Since:
    1.0

        public void loadFromXml(@NotNull
                        @NotNull org.w3c.dom.Element xmlElement,
                        @Nullable
                        @Nullable java.util.LinkedList refObjectList)
                 throws DynXmlObjParseException
        Description copied from interface: IDynXmlObject
        Loads this object from an XML DOM Document element. The DynXmlObjLoader has parsed the element and attributes to determine that this is a dynamically loaded object, found and instantiated the class, and is now sending the node to the object so it can initialize itself based on the contents of the node.
        Specified by:
        loadFromXml in interface IDynXmlObject
        Overrides:
        loadFromXml in class Blinn
        Parameters:
        xmlElement - The dynamically loaded object DOM Document element.
        refObjectList - A linked list if named objects (implementing the INamedObject interface) that have already been loaded and can be used to resolve object references.
        Throws:
        DynXmlObjParseException - Thrown if there was an error parsing the object. If this exception is thrown it should be assumed that this object was incorrectly initialized, is invalid, and should not be used in any further operations.
